page.title: 09Stoke Albany - Houses
page.content: Stoke Albany is built around a crossroads. Four smaller lanes lead from the Ashley Road.They are called Chapel Lane, Green Lane, Bottom Lane and Middle Lane. Most of the houses are old, but many have been recently renovated. Most houses in Stoke are expensive. They are nearly all large detached houses made of stone. Some are new but made to look old and fit in well with their surroundings. There is one pub and on the Ashley Road is the old Manor House. Middle Lane has mainly detached old houses. Many are Victorian and contain dormer windows. Chapel Lane is narrow and has no pavements, but the gardens are well kept. The houses are a mixture of semi-detached, detached and terraced. At the top of Bottom Lane are pebbledash houses. The row of council houses is pre-war.
